thread.title: When's the Australian GP on Sky?
thread.title_full: When's the Australian GP on Sky?

title: When's the Australian GP on Sky?
text:
When's the Australian GP on Sky Sports and how can you watch it? Last Updated: 22/03/17 8:12pm Here we go! The Formula 1 season starts here and there are a host of ways you can watch the Australian GP on Sky F1. 
One of the most eagerly-anticipated F1 seasons is ready for lift off and it all begins in Melbourne on March 24-26. 
With Ferrari and Red Bull poised to challenge Mercedes' recent supremacy, F1 in 2017 should be unmissable - and you won't miss a thing with Sky Sports F1, starting with the Australian GP. 
The essential time for the new season's curtain-raiser is 6am - the start time, in the UK, for both qualifying and Sunday's race - with all of the track action simulcast on both Sky Sports 1 and Sky Sports F1. 
How can you watch the Australian GP on Sky Sports? All of Sky Sports F1's coverage for the Formula 1 2017 season can be found on channel 408. 
Race Control, offering multiple driver cams, the pitlane channel, driver tracker and an up-to-date timing page, will be available on the Red Button as well as our Sky Sports for iPad service for those of you on the move, or you can follow the race by signing into Sky Go . 
And finally, our digital platforms - including the Sky Sports website and smartphone app - will have all the news and insights from Melbourne both before and after race day, with every session covered live in our live blog . 
Wednesday March 24 8.30pm - F1 Report: Australian GP Preview 
Thursday March 23
